It's Mastery's first-ever Self-Care Sunday! When you are responsible for other people, you also have a responsibility to take care of yourself. As they say during airplane safety videos, "put on your own oxygen mask first before assisting others." Everyone's self-care may look a little different, and there's no single way to take good care of yourself. Try some different strategies until you have a full toolbox: something that energizes you, something that helps you unwind, something that helps you manage when you're having a hard time. We'll be posting suggestions and gentle reminders right here on a weekly basis!

Today's reminder: Hydrate!! Experts recommend drinking 64 oz of water each day. Even mild dehydration can alter a person's mood, energy level, and ability to think clearly.

#SelfCareSunday #MasteryStrong

shared_text:
The Superhero Teacher's Resources
January 8 at 7:47 PM ·

Layla, the winner of Extreme Makeover Classroom Edition, teaches African American History in Philadelphia! She and her students are extremely deserving (as are all teachers). After asking Layla and her students what they wanted in their classroom, it was clear they wanted two things: vibrant colors and empowering art! With that in mind, I flipped the classroom into an interactive art gallery. At each art print, there is a QR code that links to a motivational speech, article or poem from African American history.

DISCLAIMER: Classroom makeovers are how I like to give back to the teaching community. I did not make any money from this. Teachers should not have to spend a dime of their own money on their classroom, but unfortunately, that is often the case. I want to show teachers that they are valued and this is how I personally do it.

Thanks to Hertz Furniture for so generously donating the classroom furniture! Layla and her students loved it!
